headline: ‘No reasons to own’: Software stocks sink on fear of new AI tool
summary: The release of a new artificial intelligence tool from startup Anthropic on Jan. 12 rekindled fears about disruption that weighed on software makers in 2025.  TurboTax owner Intuit Inc. tumbled 16% last week, its worst since 2022, while Adobe Inc. and Salesforce Inc., which makes customer relationship management software, both sank more than 11%.  All told, a group of software-as-a-service stocks tracked by Morgan Stanley is down 15% so far this year, following a drop of 11% in 2025.
